definitions.definition: A point; the sharp end or top of anything that terminates in a point; as, the peak, or front, of a cap.
The highest value reached by some quantity in a time period.
definitions.example: The stock market reached a peak in September 1929.

definitions.definition: The top, or one of the tops, of a hill, mountain, or range, ending in a point.
definitions.example: They reached the peak after 8 hours of climbing.

definitions.definition: The whole hill or mountain, especially when isolated.
The upper aftermost corner of a fore-and-aft sail.
The narrow part of a vessel's bow, or the hold within it.
The extremity of an anchor fluke; the bill.
A local maximum of a function, e.g. for sine waves, each point at which the value of y is at its maximum.
To reach a highest degree or maximum.
definitions.example: Historians argue about when the Roman Empire began to peak and ultimately decay.

definitions.definition: To rise or extend into a peak or point; to form, or appear as, a peak.
To raise the point of (a gaff) closer to perpendicular.
To acquire sharpness of figure or features; hence, to look thin or sickly.
